reviews.text: Not worth the low cost of staying at a hostel. Night staff were incredibly rude and unhelpful.
reviews.title: Stay away at all costs

likes.disliked: — Staff is so rude it's unbelieveable

reviews.text: We stayed in this hostel for one night. It was right down on first and Pike in a great location. The room was clean and the bed was pretty comfortable. The room was kind of hot and stuffy, but that is to be expected. The rates were good and so was the free Sunday morning breakfast.
reviews.title: Pretty cool place, awesome location!

reviews.text: Make sure you bring a towel, 2 if you can....the bathroom floor is usually wet in the bathroom. Also, dont forget a lock for the cubby to keep your bags when you go venture outside the hostel.
reviews.title: worst staff ever

reviews.text: after booking 3 beds with them over the phone,we arrived and the woman behind the counter said she had no reservation for us and nothing available but if we wanted to come back after 11pm at night after the red sox mariners game,we could see if they had any open beds. not getting a room was certainly terrible,but that womens attitude was without question the worst i've ever encountered. good luck to anyone who stays here.
reviews.title: Great location, great price.

reviews.text: Very good independent hostel. Good facility in great location across from Pike St public market. The windows stayed open (no A/C), and that led to a little street noise, but beds were comfortable and clean. Rooms with double beds had privacy curtains. Recommended.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: I agreed to stay at a hostel in Seattle with some apprehension - I'd never stayed in one before, and while I'm not a priss, I don't consider myself a "hostel girl." I love a good bargain, but I also value space, privacy and cleanliness. I really expected to try it for one night and then be ready to ditch it for a hotel. Well ... to my surprise, I kinda loved the Green Tortoise!
reviews.title: Very pleasant surprise!

likes.liked: — Great value for great bed and bath amenities
likes.disliked: — Somewhat funky smell in the common area; no elevator

reviews.text: My two friends and I stayed two nights in a four-person room for $30 each per night. The room had two sets of bunk beds, a sink, a full-length mirror and a desk. It also had four lockable under-bed storage areas, each one half the size of a twin bed so big enough for a large suitcase and other bags. (Bring your own lock, or you can purchase one from the vending machine downstairs for $5.) Each bunk had a light, a fan and a dark curtain to surround it for privacy. The beds were overall comfortable and clean - although the wool blanket looked a little scratchy and old, so I used my own blanket to cover up with and used theirs to prop up the rather thin pillow. You can rent a towel and washcloth from the front desk for $1, but I brought my own.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: The bathrooms were not, as I expected, large dorm-style rooms with toilet stalls on one side and shower stalls on the other. Instead, each of the probably 12 bathrooms on the floor had a shower, a toilet and a sink. Each was also was well-equipped with an outlet, paper towels, a ledge below the mirror, a couple of hooks for your towel and one of those cool rain shower heads that comes straight down from the ceiling! The bathrooms had been recently redone with nice tiling. The only bad things about them - most of them didn't ventilate well so it was really hot drying your hair, and some of them did not have a glass partition between the shower head and the rest of the bathroom. Each bathroom was slightly different, though, so check around to find the ones you like best. :-)
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't spend time in the common room downstairs, but it looked well-appointed with games, a TV, couches, tables and probably 8 computers available for free use. Also didn't eat breakfast or dinner there - but they had a waffle station that smelled awesome. My friend tried the coffee and said it was too strong, so we went to the Seattle's Best across the street.
reviews.title: A great hostel!
Will most definitely come back!
reviews.text: The Green Tortoise has discounted parking at the West End (?) parking deck a block down the street - bring your parking ticket in for validation, and you can park there for $15 a day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked into a private room at the Green Tortoise for two nights - a Friday and a Saturday. The location is fantastic - directly opposite Pike Market.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: We arrived early on the bus from Vancouver - around 9.30am. We were told that the room they wanted to put us in was not ready but that they did have a private room available. Only catch was that it was above the common room and it might be noisy. We didnt mind and said that was fine. The lovely girl at check-in then told us that the room would be only $60 per night! That is a saving of $17 per night.
reviews.title: The Funky Green Tortoise Was Fabulous, Great, and Terrific

likes.liked: — The free internet access and price.

reviews.text: The room was very clean - one large double (or bigger?) bed and a bunk on top. We had the whole room just for two people. The rooms were warm and very comfortable. The rooms had a little table and chair and a sink.
reviews.title: One of the very best I've seen

reviews.text: Breakfast was pretty good - we didnt eat much though. Free internet is always great.
reviews.title: A fun hostel

reviews.text: The Friday night was quite noisy but we had had a few beers and thought it was funny - some guy singing every song he knew at the top of his voice. Saturday though was very quiet - or maybe I just slept too deeply!
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a couple, the whole 'double beds in dorms' experience was interesting. We stayed in what was basically a 10 bed dorm with double bunks, yet retained some privacy by using curtains surrounding each bed.
reviews.title: Something different

likes.disliked: — cramped space in a 10 bed dorm

reviews.text: Friendly atmosphere, the organised activities, free breakfasts (waffles!) and free dinner every second night make it a very economical stay for the traveller on a budget.
reviews.title: The best place to stay downtown

reviews.text: I've stayed at GT many, many times over the years and while there have been occasional stumbles, my experiences here were by far better than almost anywhere.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place to Stay!

likes.disliked: — bunk rooms (many people coming in and out at odd hours)

reviews.text: The staff is usually knowledgeable (this knowledge seems to taper off during the day...) and always friendly. Rooms are cleaned daily, though your roommates will have a profound affect on appearance and smell. Not all rooms have a sink, but there are plenty of large bathrooms with shower, toilet, shelf and sink; some have hooks. Each of the twin beds has a locker underneath... bring your own lock or buy one in the vending machine for $5.
reviews.title: Best hostel I've ever stayed in

likes.disliked: — No milk or cream for coffee/tea

reviews.text: Don't forget about the $20 cash deposit for the room key! (There are ATMs at the front desk and downstairs.)
reviews.title: Fantastic hostel
